boat.name: Ragamuffin
boat.full_description:
In the late seventies the 'Ragamuffin' was sold to The Netherlands, where she has remained ever since. The boat and her owner played an important role in the OGA-NL history. '

In 2016, she changed hands and 'Ragamuffin' was commissioned by Whaleboat for an overhaul with new paint finish, antifouling etc. completed in late 2018.
boat.short_description: 'Ragamuffin' is a Heard 28, built by Terry Heard in 1970, Mylor, Cornwall. She has been kept in the Netherlands since the late 1970s.

for_sales.sales_text:
"Ragamuffin" is a Falmouth working boat, oyster dredger, Heard 28, built 1970 by T.R. Heard at Mylor Creek, Cornwall.

She sleeps four in two cabins. Self-draining cockpit. Electrics-12/220V. LOA12.5m, LOD 8.54m, LWL 8.5m,Beam3m, Draft 1.54m Deplacement 9 tons. Gaff cutter: Dacron 76 sq.m Dacron sails. Mainsail, topsail, staysail, jib, flying jib. Wykeham Martin roller furling gear. GRP hull, topside wood kerouing with Oregon pine mast, spruce gaff, lifting bowsprit and iron ballast keel. Lead blocks inside.

Vetus 10176/32955  09-17058 27 hp diesel engine 30-6-1995 de Bruyn/ Den Ouden Watersport Weesp Python Drive homokinetic link Radice folding 2 blade propellor.

Anchor winch, groundtackle x2 (One CQR at the bow) JVC Radio with CD player and i-pod dock, Furuno GPS navigator Chartplotter, Raymarine Autohelm autopilot, Victron inverter depth sounder log, AIRMAR Skin through hull transducers for depth/speed, BEP Voltmeter, WEATHERDOCK AIS with integrated antenna splitter, Western-co solar panel charge controller, RayMarine inverter/controller, Whale Gusher Manual Bilge Pump, Jabsco Pump, Ginballed three burner gas stove with oven, Sestrel compass, ICOM VHF radio. Toilet renewed 2018/19 x2 solar panels, x3 batteries.

Currently lying ashore under cover: Port Jachthaven Naarden, Holland 1411 LV

Part exchange is possible.
